title: Sea Level Rise in the United States

content.description: Since 1901, the sea level across the globe has risen over <math alttext="20 centimeters" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The change in sea level can be affected by land movement. Land movement itself can be caused by subsiding coastal lands, oil and water extraction, and plate tectonics. The diagram shows the relative sea level rise at various coastal locations in the United States from 1960 to 2014.
content.question: Based on the information in the map, which areas in the United States have experienced the greatest sea level rise?

choices.label: The Northeast and the Gulf of Mexico
The Southeast and the West Coast
The state of California and the state of Hawaii
The Pacific Northwest and the state of Alaska

content.answer: The Northeast and the Gulf of Mexico

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain how environmental concepts and processes represented visually relate to broader environmental issues.
